mcm.graphics
Class Body

java.lang.Object
  mcm.graphics.Body
Direct Known Subclasses:
Actor
public class Body
extends java.lang.Object

Bodys are used to draw shapes to a graphics context. Bodys have a position, a rotation angle, and a reference to a Shape,

A body's draw method draws its shape such that the shape's hot spot appears at its current position and the shape's baseline is oriented along its movement direction. More formually: Each body has its own coordinate system whith its origin at the body's current position. The coordinate system is rotated according to the body's direction angle. A body draws itself such that its shape's hotspot appears at the origin of its coordinate system.

Constructor Detail

Body

public Body()
Constructs a new body object. This constructor has the same effect as Body(null).

Body

public Body(Body template)

Constructs a new body object.

The new body receives a default name of the form <Class>#<id>, where <Class> is the body's unqualified class name and <id> a unique positive integer number.

If template equals null default values are used to initialize properties:

position (0,0) see jumpTo(Point)
direction 0 see setDirection(double)
visibility true see setVisible(boolean)
shape rotation mode true see jumpTo(Point)
shape DirectionShape(20,20) see setShape(mcm.graphics.Shape)
If a non null template is given properties are copied from the given template body. The new body receives a copy of (not a reference to) the template's shape.

Parameters:
template - the body from which to template properties
Method Detail

clone

protected java.lang.Object clone()
Creates a copy of this body by calling the default constructor. The copy's name is set to this.getName() + "*". The cloned body has the same type and properties as this body. Its shape is a copy of (not a reference) to this object's shape.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object

contains

public boolean contains(double x,
                        double y)
Checks whether the interior of this body's shape contains the point (x,y). Assumes that the shape is positioned according to this body's current position, direction, and shape rotation mode.

Parameters:
x - x coordinate
y - y coordinate
Returns:
true if (x,y) lies within the shape's area, false otherwise

contains

public boolean contains(Point pos)
The same as contains(pos.x, pos.y)

copyProps

public void copyProps(Body template)
Copies template's properties into this body. The copied properties are: position, direction, visibility, and shape rotation mode. This body receives a copy of (not a reference to) the template's shape.

Parameters:
template - a non null body

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draws this body's shape to the given graphics context at the current position. draw first transforms the given graphics context's coordinate system according to this body's position, direction, and shape rotation mode so that the hotSpot point of its shape is mapped to the point (0,0). It then calls paint, and finally restores the graphics context to its orignal coordinate transformation.

Parameters:
g - the graphics context to draw to

getTransform

protected java.awt.geom.AffineTransform getTransform()
Returns this body's transformation. Each body has its own coordinate system with the origin at its current position. If the body's shape rotation mode is set to true its coordinate system is rotated according to its direction. getTransform() returns a transformation that transforms points into the logical coordinates of this body's coordinate system.

Returns:
this body's tranformation

gotoPos

public Point gotoPos(double dist)
Retunrs the point dist away from the body's current position. The returned point is computed as:
newx = curx + dist * cos(angle)
newy = cury + dist * sin(angle)
where angle is the angle of this body's current moevement direction.

Returns:
the point (newx, newy)

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Checks whether the body's shape is visible.

Returns:
true if shape is visisble; false otherwise.

jump

public void jump(double dist)
Jump the given distance from the current position in the current movement direction. The body's position is set to the point at the 'end of the jump'.

jumpTo

public void jumpTo(double tox,
                   double toy)
Sets the body's position to point (tox, toy).

Parameters:
tox - the destination point's x coordinate
toy - the destination point's y coordinate

Sets the body's position to the given point.

Parameters:
to - the body's new position

left

public void left(double angle)
Changes movement direction by turning angle degrees to the left.
This has the same effect as setDirection(getDirection() + angle).

Parameters:
angle - the turning angle in degrees

Parameters:

right

public void right(double angle)
Changes movement direction by turning angle degrees to the right.
This has the same effect as setDirection(getDirection() - angle).

Parameters:
angle - the turning angle in degrees

rotatesShape

public boolean rotatesShape()
Checks whether shape is rotated according to movement direction.

Returns:
true if shape is rotated; false otherwise.

setDirection

public void setDirection(double angle)
Sets the body's movement direction in degrees.

A movement angle of

  • 0 -- means movement direction is to the right.
  • 90 -- means movement direction is up wards.
  • 180 -- means movement direction is to the left.
  • 270 -- means movement direction is down wards.
All values in between are interpreted as acccordingly.

Parameters:
angle - the movement angle given in degrees

setDirection

protected void setDirection(double dx,
                            double dy)
Sets the direction angle so that the body moves along a line with slope dx / dy. The body is directed towards the point defined by (currentPos.x + dx, currentPos.y + dy), where currentPos is the body's current position.

Parameters:
dx - delta x for slope definition
dy - delta y for slope definition

setMapDirection

public void setMapDirection(int dir)
Sets the body's movement direction. The avaailable modes are:
NORTH
movement direction to the North/up wards.
EAST
movement direction to the East/right.
SOUTH
movement direction to the South/down wards.
WEST
movement direction to the West/left.
NORTHEAST
movement direction to the Northeast.
SOUTHEAST
movement direction to the Southeast.
NORTHWEST
movement direction to the Northwest.
SOUTHWEST
movement direction to the Southwest.

setName

public void setName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the body's name.

setRotatesShape

public void setRotatesShape(boolean rot)
Sets whether the body's shape is rotated according to this shape's movement direction.

Parameters:
rot - true or false.

setShape

public void setShape(Shape shape)
Sets the body's shape to the given shape.

Parameters:
shape - non null shape.

setHeight

public void setHeight(double height)
Sets the height of this body's shape to the given height in pixels; The same as calling setSize(getWidth(), height).

Parameters:
height - the new height; must be greater zero

setHotSpot

public void setHotSpot(int mode)
Sets the hot spot mode of this body's shape.

The shape's hotSpot mode determines how its lower left corner is positioned relative to the body's current position.

The available modes are:

Shape.CENTER
put the shape's center at the body's current position
Shape.UPPER_LEFT
put the shape's upper left corner at the body's current position
SHape.UPPER_RIGHT
put the shape's upper right corner at the body's current position
Shape.LOWER_LEFT
put the shape's lower left corner at the body's current position
Shape.LOWER_RIGHT
put the shape's lower right corner at the body's current position
Shape.LOWER_CENTER
put the shape's midpoint on its lower side at the body's current position
Shape.UPPER_CENTER
put the shape's midpoint on its upper side at the body's current position
Shape.MIDDLE_LEFT
put the shape's midpoint on its left side at the body's current position
Shape.MIDDLE_RIGHT
put the shape's midpoint on its right side at the body's current position
Shape.FIXED_POINT
put the shape's hotSpot at the body's current position.

Parameters:
mode - the new hotSpot mode

setHotSpotPoint

public void setHotSpotPoint(Point hotSpotPoint)
Sets the hot spot of this body's shape to the given point; as well as the shape's hotSpot mode to Shape.FIXED_POINT. The hot spot point is interpreted relative to the lower left corner of the body's shape. When the body is drawn its shape is positioned such that the hotspot point appears at the body's current position. When the shape is resized it's hotSpot point is not adjusted.

Parameters:
hotSpotPoint - the new hotSpot to set.

setLineWidth

public void setLineWidth(int lineWidth)
Set's the linewidth of this body's shape. The same as getShape().setLineWidth(lineWidth)

Parameters:
lineWidth - the new width

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
Set's the color of this body's shape. The same as getShape().setColor(color)

Parameters:
color - the new color

Parameters:
width - the new width; must be greater zero

                            double y)
The same as transFromLocal(x,y,null).

Returns:
a newly allocated point

transFromLocal

public Point transFromLocal(double x,
                            double y,
                            Point global)
Returns the global coordinates for the point (x,y). Interpretes as (x,y) as coordinates in this body's coordinate system and transforms them to global coordinates. Returns the computed coordinates in global if non null or in a newly allocated point.

Parameters:
x - x ccordinate
y - y coordinate
global - null or reference to a point
Returns:
global, if not null, or newly allocated point

transToGlobal

public Point transToGlobal(int alignment)
The same as transToGlobal(alignment, null)

Returns:
a newly allocated point

transToGlobal

public Point transToGlobal(int alignment,
                           Point global)
Returns the global coordinates of the point at the given alignment position in this body's shape. The alignment value indicates which point's coordinates are requested. Returns the computed coordinates in global if non null or in a newly allocated point.

Parameters:
alignment - any alignment value from Shape except Shape.FIXED_POINT
Returns:
global, if not null, or newly allocated point
See Also:
Shape.getPos(int, Point)

transToLocal

public Point transToLocal(double x,
                          double y)
The same as transToLocal(x,y,null).

Returns:
a newly allocated point

transToLocal

public Point transToLocal(double x,
                          double y,
                          Point local)
Returns the local coordinates for the point (x,y). Computes the coordinates for the point (x,y) in this body's coordinate system. Returns the computed coordinates in local if non null or in a newly allocated point.

Parameters:
x - x ccordinate
y - y coordinate
local - null or reference to a point
Returns:
local, if not null, or newly allocated point
